intro: Mentzelia acerosa, commonly known as the sharpleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and often have a sharp, pointed tip, giving it its common name. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in late spring to early summer.
